reviews.text: Our work staff had a day away there. The antebellum home was nicely appointed, and I can say that we had what was easily one of the best five meals I have had in the last year. Cornish hen, Johnny cake with a spinach and cream sauce, and creme brulee cheesecake... Very much looking forward to a return trip with a lunch.
A beautiful antebellum home tucked away in the suburbs of Birmingham Al. A gorgeous home built in the greek revival style complete with furnishings from the post civil war era.

I love this old house.  People running it are sincere and pleasant.  Wonderful piece of history that I enjoy sharing with vistors to Bham.....that being said...flaking paint and rotting wood on the house breaks my heart.
If only this style of home was still readily available on today's market.
Nice attraction, Jovonn was very informative

I have heard about the Alabama Theatre forever and have never been inside. This past Friday I went there for an event and was blown away with the beauty of this venue. Hands down gorgeous. Highly recommend attending events here. I'm now wanting to visit for one of their movie showings just to enjoy the atmosphere of this Birmingham Landmark.

My first time & it was a beautiful venue. We saw Jackson Browne. Ticketmaster won't let me pull my tickets up or I would list my seat #'s. We sat on the bottom in the very back on the lefthand side. It was very convenient as a door was right beside us but we were the end of the row that ended shorter than the regular rows so we were the only ones I saw use that door. We could see & hear everything beautifully. The concessions moved very quickly. The bathrooms (in the basement) were very big & clean. We got there early & bar hopped (walking) beforehand. All of the ushers & employees of the Alabama Theatre were nice & helpful. I would definitely recommend this venue & plan on returning!!

Great and beautiful venue. Just not ideal for a large dance competition. The dressing areas and backstage are a tight squeeze for 10+ studios with 300+ parents teachers and dancers all trying to move quickly.

This is always such a great venue. It has the old theatre charm and there really isn't a bad seat in the house. We prefer the floor or side mezzanine seating if we get the chance to go to a concert or play. Only negative is bathrooms are either in the basement or all the way up stairs.

This venue can't be beat for live performances. The acoustics are awesome. The history of the Alabama theatre adds to the charm and the ambience. I love seeing my favorite artists here. Jackson Browne was no exception. He played some of his set, but also you audience requests. Hard to believe he's been doing what he di does so well for so long. Can't wait to see him again.

No one Loves fried green tomatoes more then me and besides what my mother and grandmother cooked the whistle stop has the best I've ever eaten. If you pass through our beautiful state of Alabama you must stop in .I promise you want be disappointed!

First visit. Delicious food. I felt it was a bit pricey for normal southern food. But the taste made me forget about her w much I had just spent. Very satisfied. And outside is the neatest little spot to sit and watch the train.

Thia place is fantastic, if you like country comfort food then you will love this place
 There fried green tomatoes are fantastic. But you better get there early or you may end up waiting in a long line. Also got some of the best sweet tea

Irondale Cafe catered lunch for our child development center in November of 2018. The food arrived at the perfect time, everything was delicious the children enjoyed every bit of it. AWESOME STAFF! Ordered two times after and plan to order again! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Wow, just wow, the fried green tomatoes are out of this world! Incredibly delicious food and wonderful atmosphere. You walk in and help yourself to a tray and plate of dessert, then make your way around the corner to order your main course and sides, grab a drink and take a seat where ever you like. Servers are patient and helpful. Waitresses will refill your drink when it's still 3/4 full and make sure you're enjoying your meal, great service. Pay at counter where they have t shirts and cookbooks available, card or cash is acceptable. Truly a heart warming experience eating here, will be visiting again soon!

The food is excellent here! If you're looking for a quick bite, this isn't your place until you have time to kill. They make everything up fresh and it shows! Well worth the wait! My favourites are the chicken and beef shawarmas, and the BBQ chicken baker!
I felt like I was eating at my Yia Yia's; the food was excellent. Service was efficient and friendly and helpful. Lots of room to sit and eat.

Employees need to be trained on allergies and should not answer if they are not certain. If you are not sure, then say so.  Some allergies can be a life of death situation!  Thank God it wasn't like that for my husband. Just bad hives and being very uncomfortable for the rest of the day and into the night.  Won't go back since we can not trust the information given.
Love this place. Always clean and the food is fresh!
Food is overpriced, and greasy. The atmosphere of the resturant also leaves something to be desired.
Great food with a cool interior. The environment is also great. I had the Cuban taco and the fish taco. They were amazing.
It's a bit pricey for Mexican food, but the food has always been delicious. The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is great,  and the margaritas are bomb! Also, the peach tea is delish!

I enjoyed the service. Very attentive to customer and willing to accommodate. The food was a little $ for the portions. Menu is more America-ized Mexican food. Enjoyed my salmon and the churros were delicious
Food is good, prices reasonable, casual, fun atmosphere.  Taco Tuesday night, but ran out of keto tacos....must have been good....will be back....🚴‍♂️🚴‍♂️🚴‍♂️
Authentic Mexican food in my opinion. I had the Chicken Enchiladas made the way I like it!

The menu prices are incorrect so expect your ticket to be higher than it should be. No reduction in the ticket when the server noticed the menu price is lower than what you are charged. Whole Foods gives you the item for free if it rings up incorrectly no matter the cost...just saying

Good food, good service. This isn't my favorite BBQ joint in Birmingham but it is good.

The biscuits are made daily from scratch, so delicious.

This place flies just a little below the radar, and I'm not sure why. Excellent BBQ with wonderful sauce, nice sides, staggeringly-good desserts...this is an absolutely top-tier BBQ joint. Deserves to be on your list of regular haunts. Trust me.

I don't go here often because I don't go to the Hoover- Homewood area very often. When I do go, I often go to Demetri's BBQ because their food is really good. They've been around for decades, so they have had plenty of time to 'get it right'. Everything I have had has been good,  and they give you plenty of food for the money. I will be going back.

I had a horrible first time experience. We visited Demetri’s for my two friends birthday. We had a wonderful server, Trish, who ensured that our food was served in a timely manner. Along with that she provided exceptional customer service. However, we had an issue with our ticket cost. Upon receiving our tickets, we noticed that there was an upcharge for the wings. Not that it is a huge issue, but we did want to point out to the server and management that a customer can be mislead by the cost of the wings. When the two managers came to the table, one male and one female, the male got very aggressive with us. He made a comment that said, “Do you expect us to put the price of everything on the menu.” Then he made several other sarcastic remarks. Ending with statement saying that, “I was not a big his big fan.” 

He missed the full picture. We did not mind paying for the food. We just wanted the company to understand that the cost of their food is misleading. I, along with my friends will not be returning to Demetri’s. Management was very poor and insulting.
They didn't have what I wanted to order (sold out) the first time.  Same thing with my second choice.  What I got was just ok and desert all three of us had was not good at all.  It tasted very old.

One of my all-time favorite restaurants. This place is a true gem. It's not a small place by any means but it feels very intimate. The lighting is perfect. I always have steak or fish when I visit. I'll often order the trio that comes with another dish as well. If you like dessert, everything on Bright Star's dessert menu is to die for. I'll often only eat a few bites of my entree and take most of it home just so I can enjoy one of their delicious desserts. If you've never been here, you're really missing out. I dare anyone to try it and not go back a second and third time.

This place is an icon. The food and service are as great as ever! Memorabilia makes the place like a delightful museum. Wine prices are surprisingly reasonable, and they offer full bar service with some specialty drinks like Long Island Tea. They still serve bread and butter! I had the special of the day which was stuffed snapper, quite good. The menu is a mixture of Greek and Southern, they even have peanut butter pie. Atmosphere is cordial and comfortable, dress is somewhat upscale like business casual. Thankfully a respite from modern chain restaurants, the Bright Star is its own good thing. There are tables for big groups, and comfy booths for a date or small gathering. Highly recommend!

A must for anyone who wants to experience a truly authentic and amazing local dining experience! The oldest restaurant in Alabama features incredible early 1900 murals and tile work creating a unique atmosphere and attraction. It is the first Alabama restaurant to receive the James Beard Award for culinary excellence. The food is excellent and the staff is equally as good. A consistently Great experience!

This was our first visit. I'm in love with this place. The history, the food, and the staff are all wonderful. I had the country fried steak, fried okra, rice and spinach casserole, and pickled beets. My boyfriend had country fried steak, okra, and mashed potatoes with gravy. We ordered peanut butter pie and lemon pie for dessert. The restaurant ambassador came to our table and talked with us and showed us the Alabama room. What a delightful lady. I truly enjoyed talking with her. I highly recommend the Bright Star.

This is a restaurant that you will want to visit several times. The food is excellent and the service is very good. Their prices are a little on the  high side.  You can expect to paid about $40 per person for a meal including drink and desert.  This restaurant is an excellent choice for special occasions. Don't forget to include 15 to 20 percent gratuity for your server, they earn it.

The service was good the space was tremendously tight we didn't have turn around room.  When my wife and I got there to greet my family I couldn't get to them because of limited space. Thinking this was a upscale place there should have been more space. Not to mention the parking!! Not a good selection for food,there was no veggies to choose from. They dont consider the people with food allergies. My mother in law couldn't eat off the menu because they cook everything in the same grease.,she had to eat a salad. I ordered the rib eye and my wife a salad. The food was good. This was a moment for Chef Ramsey. People was standing over one another because it was no where to sit. The waiters had to squeeze between people to get by.  They need space!!

Very impressive restaurant.  All of our meals were cooked to perfection.  I ordered the Pompano Fish which was seasoned and hickory grilled to perfection.  I highly recommend this restaurant for date night or a business meeting.  You will not be disappointed.
Very romantic atmosphere, casual ....but yet touched by the vibe. The food is perfect and the soul sushi is the best! So fresh and the filet was amazing!! Can’t say enough about how good the food is.
Excellent food all around. The waitstaff is very attentive and helpful with recommendations. Would have been a five star but the lighting in the side room is really odd and almost distracting.
Excellent Oysters! So many choices! They can also prepare delicious gluten free meals if you have an allergy.

Birthday dinner... For the win!!! 
Been wanting to try this spot and it did not disappoint. Service, food, atmosphere all top notch.
Everything we had was amazing, beautifully plated and paired very nicely together. Listen to the waiters, they won't steer you wrong!
Perfect dining experience. Perfect food and service. Nothing you've ever eaten before served in beautiful hand=thrown pottery. Nice selection of wines by the glass.

They have a good, unique selection that comes at a price. Rabbit was really well cooked and I recommend trying that. Steak was ok, nothing special for a restaurant of this caliber. Desserts were ok too, again, nothing I will remember in a few months.
One of Birmingham's best. Outdoor seating in season. Always creative menu. Worth a visit, make a reservation.
Great atmosphere and service but their steak leaves a lot of room for improvement.

HIGHLANDS BAR AND GRILL

This restaurant is a sublime experience.  The moment you walk 
in the door and greeted by your name, ushered immediately to 
a table, and immediately engaged by your waiter you know you
have arrived in Nirvana.
Valet parking was easy.  Our table was ready on arrival, and service was excellent.  The food was outstanding - we had veal with sweetbreads and Red Snapper as mains with two different appetizers.(the grits, in particular, were excellent).  
Since Frank Stitt received the national James Beard Award, it has 
been necessary to make reservations.  This can be done easily on the
Open Table App.  
The food is always divine. The fish is always perfectly 
cooked. I recently had the trigger fish with spinach and vegetables.
My wife had oysters and soft shell crab.  Frank has a wonderful and 
reasonably priced wine list.  He is famous for his stoned ground baked grits 
with prosciutto and thyme.  My wife and I think his martini is the best in the world.

These people are the "food whisperers" and offered the most exceptional customer service I've ever experienced at a restaurant. Everything was perfect, even when one of the managers saw us standing around waiting and offered to make our drinks himself. The food was exceptional beyond words, there is no question why this place is a James Beard award winner. Book MONTHS in advance and prepare for an experience you will not forget. Highly recommend!!!

Managed a 6pm reservation on a Friday night.  Valet parking was easy.  Our table was ready on arrival, and service was excellent.  The food was outstanding - we had veal with sweetbreads and Red Snapper as mains with two different apps (the grits, in particular, were excellent).  At this price point, anything but perfect shouldn't be tolerated...luckily...we couldn't find a single issue aside from it being in Birmingham while we're from Huntsville :-)

Very busy upscale restaurant and bar. The drinks were reasonable and the food was very tasty. Service was outstanding. Only issue was the bar area which is first come first serve was super busy and we waited about 2 hours to get a spot. Felt like I was putting pressure on the people sitting at the bar.

Highlands is the definition of excellence. Everything is top notch from the moment you walk in to the moment you leave. Easily the best dining experience I’ve had in Birmingham, and it’s always consistent. Highly recommended.
